translations.profile:
By pursuing a career as a software engineer, I had contact with different IT companies, meeting people from all over the world.

Having worked in a fast-moving environment on a few projects around the Dutch pension administration system, I was able to develop crucial technical, flexibility and adaptability skills. Looking for different challenges, I joined a cloud contact center company, working with hundreds of top-notch engineers to deliver the best innovative solutions to the market.

Over the past 5 years, I have worked with many different technologies, with particular focus on the Java language and its best frameworks and practices. As a team player, I believe teamwork and positivity always bring the best results.

talkdesk.title: Talkdesk
talkdesk.summary: Workforce Engagement and Management solutions for contact  centers.
talkdesk.details:
Development of core services for an event-driven microservice architecture using Java 17 and Quarkus;

Development of a multi-storage solution in Java and Ruby and integration with Azure Storage.

cgi.title: CGI
cgi.summary:
Acquisition of RiskCo by a consortium which includes CGI.

Same responsibilities as in the previous role.

riskco.title: InAdmin RiskCo
riskco.summary: Administrative solutions for Dutch pension institutions. Fast-moving environment requiring a great sense of resilience and adaptability to multiple technologies and projects.
riskco.details:
Development of client-server components for a PaaS system, mainly based on Java, Spring Boot and ReactJS with a GraphQL API, to visualize and treat of big sets of pension data;

Development and maintenance of Groovy libraries;

Customer support to a client-server Windows based application (C#) used in the calculation of theoretical prices for bank products;

Customer support for mobile (Android and iOS) applications and maintenance of existing Excel Macros;

Implementation of BPMN models to be integrated in the PaaS system

masters.title: Masters in Electrical and Computer Engineering
details: Dissertation: Fusion of inertial data in industrial AGVs

curricular_internship.title: Curricular Internship
details: Firmware development and hardware design for an inertial system to assist in the navigation of industrial AGVs

summer_internship.title: Summer Internship
details: Software development for a Pick & Place machine using QT Creator

associativism.title: Associativism
associativism.description:
Throughout my academic path, I have participated in many editions of engineering and robotics competitions, both as a participant and as collaborator: Bot Olympics and EBEC Coimbra. I have also been a board member of the IEEE UC Student Branch, organizing many workshops and the 2016 Leadership Camp.

Besides engineering associations and competitions, I have joined a university choir (CMUC) where I was the vice president for a year, growing many associative and leadership competencies.

Ocasionally, I participate in volunteering activities, such as volunteering at a local cat shelter and in the restoration of the native forest of Serra do Bussaco.
